Reserves and Academy|Sunderland]] | years1 = 2011–2017 | clubs1 = [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] | caps1 = 31 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2012 | clubs2 = → [[Darlington F.C.|Darlington]] (loan) | caps2 = 17 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2013 | clubs3 = → [[Alfreton Town F.C.|Alfreton Town]] (loan) | caps3 = 12 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2013 | clubs4 = → [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] (loan) | caps4 = 12 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2014 | clubs5 = → [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]] (loan) | caps5 = 18 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2014–2015 | clubs6 = → [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]] (loan) | caps6 = 33 | goals6 = 0 | years7 = 2015–2016 | clubs7 = → [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] (loan) | caps7 = 24 | goals7 = 0 | years8 = 2017– | clubs8 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | caps8 = 66 | goals8 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2009–2010 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 5 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2010–2011 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 17 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2010–2012 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalcaps3 = 3 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2012–2013 | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps4 = 8 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | nationalyears5 = 2015 | nationalteam5 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps5 = 3 | nationalgoals5 = 0 | nationalyears6 = 2015–2017 | nationalteam6 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps6 = 14 | nationalgoals6 = 0 | nationalyears7 = 2017– | nationalteam7 = [[England national football team|England]] | nationalcaps7 = 15 | nationalgoals7 = 0 | club-update = 13:16, 27 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 08:10, 27 December 2018 (UTC) }} '''Jordan Lee Pickford''' (''[[Name at birth|né]]'' '''Logan'''; born 7 March 1994)<ref name=englandfootballonline/> is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for {{English football updater|Everton}} club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] and the [[England national football team|England national team]].
Pickford has previously played for Sunderland's academy, reserve, and senior teams in addition to [[Loan (sports)|loan]] spells at [[Darlington F.C.|Darlington]], [[Alfreton Town F.C.|Alfreton Town]], [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]], [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]], [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]] and [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]]. He signed for Everton for a fee of £25 million in June 2017.
Pickford has represented England at [[England national under-16 football team|under-16]], [[England national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[England national under-18 football team|under-18]], [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]], [[England national under-20 football team|under-20]] and [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] levels. He received his first call-up from the full [[England national football team|England]] national team for the 2018 World Cup qualifier against [[Slovenia national football team|Slovenia]] in October 2016, making his debut in November 2017 in a friendly against [[Germany national football team|Germany]]. He was the starting goalkeeper in England’s 2018 World Cup fourth-place finish, leading the squad to its first semi-final appearance since 1990 with a penalty shootout victory in the second round and a clean sheet in the quarter-final.
==Early and personal life== Pickford was born in [[Washington, Tyne and Wear]],<ref>{{Hugman|26312|accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> and attended [[St Robert of Newminster Catholic School]].<ref name="SEcho_Nov2016">{{cite news |last=Wheeler |first=Katy |title=Hundreds turn up to Sunderland players' Christmas signing session |url=http://www.sunderlandecho.com/lifestyle/hundreds-turn-up-to-sunderland-players-christmas-signing-session-1-8262680 |newspaper=Sunderland Echo |accessdate=13 June 2017}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Sunderland=== Pickford joined [[Sunderland A.F.C. Reserves and Academy|Sunderland's Academy]] at the age of eight and progressed through the age groups before signing two-year scholarship terms in 2010.<ref name="skysports.com">{{cite news |last=Charles |first=Andy |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11695/10144727/sunderland-goalkeeper-jordan-pickford-signs-new-contract |title=Sunderland goalkeeper Jordan Pickford signs new contract |publisher=Sky Sports |date=26 January 2016 |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> The following year, Pickford was promoted from the Academy to the reserve team.<ref>{{cite news |title=Black Cats boss has keeper dilemma |url=http://www.thenorthernecho.co.uk/sport/9080459.Black_Cats_boss_has_keeper_dilemma/ |newspaper=The Northern Echo |location=Darlington |date=13 June 2011 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref>
In 2011, Pickford signed his first professional contract with the club.<ref>{{cite news |title=Poyet still wants Sunderland back-up, despite Pickford deal |url=http://www.sunderlandecho.com/sport/football/sunderland-afc/poyet-still-wants-sunderland-back-up-despite-pickford-deal-1-6648325 |newspaper=Sunderland Echo |date=2 June 2014 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref> The following year, Pickford signed a contract extension with the club.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sunderland sign up two players to their youth system |url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/sunderland-sign-up-two-players-1367457 |newspaper=Evening Chronicle |location=Newcastle upon Tyne |date=8 June 2012 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref>
====Loans to Darlington and Alfreton Town==== Pickford signed on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] for [[National League (division)|Conference Premier]] club [[Darlington F.C.|Darlington]] in time to make his debut against [[Fleetwood Town F.C.|Fleetwood Town]] on 21 January 2012, playing the whole of a 1–0 home loss.<ref>{{cite news |title=Keeper Jordan Pickford signs as the region rallies round Darlington FC |url=http://www.gazettelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/keeper-jordan-pickford-signs-region-3677528 |newspaper=Teesside Gazette |location=Middlesbrough |accessdate=3 August 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Match Report: Darlington 0–1 Fleetwood Town |url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/darlington-0-fleetwood-town-1-1343033 |newspaper=Evening Chronicle |location=Newcastle upon Tyne |date=22 January 2012 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref> The initial month-long loan was subsequently extended until the end of April.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sunderland keeper Jordan Pickford extends Darlington loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17105108 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 February 2012 |accessdate=3 August 2013}}</ref> Pickford went on to make seventeen appearances for Darlington,<ref name=Soccerway/> who were relegated.<ref>{{Cite web |title=A Brief History of Darlington FC |url=http://darlingtonfootballclub.co.uk/history/brief-history/ |publisher=Darlington F.C. |accessdate=14 November 2017}}</ref>
On 25 February 2013, Pickford signed for Conference Premier club [[Alfreton Town F.C.|Alfreton Town]], again on an initial month-long loan<ref>{{cite news |title=Alfreton Town sign Sunderland keeper Jordan Pickford |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21579193 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=3 August 2013}}</ref> and was a cover for [[Phil Barnes]], who was injured.<ref>{{cite news |title=Pickford moves in to help Alfreton Town with Barnes out |url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/pickford-moves-help-alfreton-barnes/story-18256218-detail/story.html |newspaper=Derby Telegraph |date=25 February 2013 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161017190852/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/pickford-moves-help-alfreton-barnes/story-18256218-detail/story.html |archivedate=17 October 2016}}</ref> He made his debut the next day in a 5–1 win over [[Hyde United F.C.|Hyde United]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Tomlinson hits hat-trick as Alfreton Town crush Hyde United |url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/tomlinson-hits-hat-trick-alfreton-town-crush-hyde/story-18265198-detail/story.html |newspaper=Derby Telegraph |date=26 February 2013 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161017191229/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/tomlinson-hits-hat-trick-alfreton-town-crush-hyde/story-18265198-detail/story.html |archivedate=17 October 2016}}</ref> His loan spell at the club was subsequently extended until the end of the season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Jordan Pickford: Alfreton Town extend Sunderland keeper's loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21964851 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=3 August 2013}}</ref> During this spell, Pickford kept five [[clean sheets]] in twelve matches.<ref name="burtonloan">{{cite news |title=Jordan Pickford: Burton agree deal Sunderland keeper |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23540671 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=3 August 2013}}</ref>
====Loans to Burton Albion and Carlisle United==== On 2 August 2013, Pickford signed another loan deal, this time with [[EFL League Two|League Two]] club Burton Albion,<ref name="burtonloan"/> and made his debut the next day against [[Cheltenham Town F.C.|Cheltenham Town]].<ref name="soccerbase">{{soccerbase|id=63860|name=Jordan Pickford}}</ref> However, his loan ended on 17 August, after Sunderland recalled him with Pickford featuring just three times for Burton.<ref name="burtontermination">{{cite news |title=Derby County keeper joins Burton Albion on loan |url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Derby-County-keeper-joins-Burton-Albion-loan/story-19673066-detail/story.html |newspaper=Derby Telegraph |accessdate=17 August 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130820084821/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Derby-County-keeper-joins-Burton-Albion-loan/story-19673066-detail/story.html |archivedate=20 August 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Lyness steps up as Pickford recalled |url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/lyness-steps-pickford-recalled/story-19677394-detail/story.html |newspaper=Derby Telegraph |date=19 August 2013 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161017192659/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/lyness-steps-pickford-recalled/story-19677394-detail/story.html |archivedate=17 October 2016}}</ref> On 13 September, Pickford re-joined Burton on loan.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.burtonalbionfc.co.uk/news/article/pickfordreturn-1049311.aspx |title=Pickford back at the Pirelli |publisher=Burton Albion F.C. |date=13 September 2013 |accessdate=7 December 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160305074939/http://www.burtonalbionfc.co.uk/news/article/pickfordreturn-1049311.aspx |archivedate=5 March 2016 |deadurl=no}}</ref> His handful of first-team appearances at Burton Albion led to an extension of his loan spell for another month.<ref>{{cite news |title=Burton Albion extend loan of Sunderland goalkeeper Jordan Pickford |url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/burton-albion-extend-loan-sunderland-goalkeeper/story-19939108-detail/story.html |newspaper=Derby Telegraph |date=16 October 2013 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131019093740/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Burton-Albion-extend-loan-Sunderland-goalkeeper/story-19939108-detail/story.html |archivedate=19 October 2013}}</ref> After making 12 appearances across his two loan spells, Pickford was recalled by his parent club once again.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.burtonalbionfc.co.uk/news/article/20131122-pickford-1190533.aspx |title=Pickford Recalled |publisher=Burton Albion F.C. |date=22 November 2013 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161017192406/http://www.burtonalbionfc.co.uk/news/article/20131122-pickford-1190533.aspx |archivedate=17 October 2016 |deadurl=no}}</ref> He subsequently spent 11 matches as an unused substitute on the bench as a cover for [[Vito Mannone]] between 23 November 2013 and 18 January 2014.<ref name=auto>{{cite news |title=Sunderland goalkeeper facing lengthy spell on the sidelines as operation looks likely |url=http://www.thenorthernecho.co.uk/sport/10890580.Sunderland_goalkeeper_facing_lengthy_spell_on_the_sidelines_as_operation_looks_likely/ |newspaper=The Northern Echo |location=Darlington |date=20 November 2013 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref>
Although it was rumoured that he could return on loan to Burton for the third time,<ref>{{cite news |title=Sunderland goalkeeper Jordan Pickford not set for third Burton Albion loan |url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/pickford-set-burton-loan/story-20493573-detail/story.html |newspaper=Derby Telegraph |date=24 January 2014 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Pickford joined League One club [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]] on a one-month loan on 8 February 2014.<ref>{{cite web |title=Loan: Keeper joins Cumbrians |url=http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/news/article/pickfordloan7feb14-1345128.aspx |publisher=Carlisle United F.C. |date=8 February 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304052314/http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/news/article/pickfordloan7feb14-1345128.aspx |archivedate=4 March 2016 |deadurl=no}}</ref> He made his debut that same day in a 2–1 loss away to [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25994422 |title=Carlisle United 1–2 Gillingham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 February 2014 |accessdate=13 June 2018}}</ref> His form and handful of first-team appearances led the club to keep him on loan for the rest of the season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/news/article/pickfordloanextends10march14-1409746.aspx |title=Loan: Keeper sticks with United |publisher=Carlisle United F.C. |date=14 March 2014 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161017194959/http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/news/article/pickfordloanextends10march14-1409746.aspx |archivedate=17 October 2016 |deadurl=no}}</ref> After extending his loan at the club, Pickford went on to make 18 appearances for Carlisle.<ref name=sb1314/>
At the end of the 2013–14 season, Pickford signed a four-year contract with Sunderland, keeping him at the club until 2018.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sunderland tie youngster to long-term deal |url=http://www.thenorthernecho.co.uk/sport/11248898.Sunderland_tie_youngster_to_long_term_deal |newspaper=The Northern Echo |location=Darlington |date=1 June 2014 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref>
====Loan to Bradford City==== On 21 July 2014, Pickford joined [[EFL League One|League One]] club Bradford City on a season-long loan for the 2014–15 season.<ref>{{cite web |title=Pickford on the move |url=http://www.safc.com/news/team-news/2014/july/pickford-on-the-move |publisher=Sunderland A.F.C. |accessdate=21 July 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140721121410/http://www.safc.com/news/team-news/2014/july/pickford-on-the-move |archivedate=21 July 2014}}</ref> He made his debut on 9 August in a 3–2 win against [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] at [[Valley Parade]],<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28646631 |title=Bradford City 3–2 Coventry City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2014 |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> and kept his first clean sheet in the following match, a 0–0 draw away to [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28716713 |title=Walsall 0–0 Bradford City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2014 |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> Pickford then received his first ever red card after he was sent off in the 11th minute of a 2–1 loss to [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] on 10 January 2015.<ref>{{cite news |title=Bradford City 1–2 Rochdale |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30663535 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 January 2015 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref> He served a one-match suspension which his club did not appeal.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/city-decide-against-pickford-appeal-2197948.aspx |title=City decide against Pickford appeal |publisher=Bradford City A.F.C. |date=12 January 2015 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161017202706/http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/city-decide-against-pickford-appeal-2197948.aspx |archivedate=17 October 2016 |deadurl=no}}</ref>
On 7 February, he was once again expelled from play as he was sent off in the last minute of a 2–2 away draw against [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Port Vale 2–2 Bradford City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31070834 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 February 2015 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref> After being given a two-match ban, the club successfully appealed and had it revoked.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/pickford-set-for-two-match-ban-2254726.aspx |title=Pickford set for two-match ban |publisher=Bradford City A.F.C. |date=7 February 2015 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150313123205/http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/pickford-set-for-two-match-ban-2254726.aspx |archivedate=13 March 2015 |deadurl=no}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/city-win-pickford-appeal-2257188.aspx |title=City win Pickford appeal |publisher=Bradford City A.F.C. |date=9 January 2015 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161017203251/http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/city-win-pickford-appeal-2257188.aspx |archivedate=17 October 2016 |deadurl=no}}</ref>
Pickford established himself as a first-choice goalkeeper for most of the season until he was recalled by his parent club on 9 March 2015.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/pickford-returns-to-sunderland-2323603.aspx |title=Pickford returns to Sunderland |publisher=Bradford City A.F.C. |date=9 March 2015 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150322175418/http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/pickford-returns-to-sunderland-2323603.aspx |archivedate=22 March 2015 |deadurl=no}}</ref>
====Loan to Preston North End==== On 31 July 2015, Pickford joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] on a season-long loan for the [[2015–16 Preston North End F.C. season|2015–16 season]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Pickford Joins Preston |url=http://www.safc.com/news/team-news/2015/july/pickford-joins-preston |publisher=Sunderland A.F.C. |date=31 July 2015}}</ref> He kept a clean sheet on his debut in a 0–0 draw against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] at [[Deepdale]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Aloia |first=Andrew |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33750467 |title=Preston North End 0–0 Middlesbrough |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2015 |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref>
Further clean sheets in a 1–0 win against [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] in his second league appearance and a 0–0 draw with [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] on 18 August made it three clean sheets from his first three league appearances for the club.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33831740 |title=MK Dons 0–1 Preston North End |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 May 2015 |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33857728 |title=Rotherham United 0–0 Preston North End |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 August 2015 |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> On 25 August, Pickford kept another clean sheet as Preston defeated [[Premier League]] team [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] 1–0 in the [[2015–16 Football League Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33969908 |title=Preston 1–0 Watford |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=29 October 2017}}</ref> On 7 November, he recorded a 6th consecutive clean sheet in a 0–0 draw against QPR, equalling the club record.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sunderlandecho.com/sport/sunderland-afc/latest-safc-news/safc-match-analysis/sam-allardyce-keeping-close-eye-on-preston-s-on-loan-sunderland-keeper-jordan-pickford-1-7553951 |title=Sam Allardyce keeping close eye on Preston's on-loan Sunderland keeper Jordan Pickford |newspaper=Sunderland Echo |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34685931 |title=Queens Park Rangers 0–0 Preston North End |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> During his stint at Preston, Pickford impressed his veteran goalkeeping teammate [[Chris Kirkland]], who said "Jordan comes out to take crosses and has an authority for someone still very young... As for his kicking, that is brilliant! I have never seen anyone kick a ball like he does."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sunderlandecho.com/sport/sunderland-afc/latest-safc-news/safc-match-analysis/going-to-the-top-pickford-could-keep-sunderland-up-says-chris-kirkland-1-7634077 |title='Going to the top' Pickford could keep Sunderland up, says Chris Kirkland |newspaper=Sunderland Echo |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> On 20 December 2015, Pickford was controversially sent off in a 1–0 defeat against [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]]: he rushed out of his box to challenge striker [[Chris Wood (footballer, born 1991)|Chris Wood]], and was judged to have handled the ball.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lep.co.uk/sport/national-football/pne-set-to-appeal-pickford-dismissal-1-7635514 |title=PNE set to appeal Pickford dismissal |newspaper=Lancashire Evening Post |location=Preston |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> Preston successfully appealed the decision, using replay footage that showed the ball hitting his chest.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lep.co.uk/sport/national-football/pne-keeper-pickford-wins-red-card-appeal-1-7638855 |title=PNE keeper Pickford wins red card appeal |newspaper=Lancashire Evening Post |location=Preston |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref>
====Return to Sunderland==== On 1 January 2016, Pickford was recalled by Sunderland, with the side struggling in 19th place in the [[2015–16 Premier League|Premier League]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Man Utd's Sam Johnstone off on loan to Preston North End |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11697/10115470/man-utds-sam-johnstone-off-on-loan-to-preston-north-end |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=31 December 2015}}</ref> He made his first-team debut on 9 January 2016, in a 3–1 [[2015–16 FA Cup|FA Cup]] loss to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Arsenal 3 Sunderland 1: Gunners fight back to knock Cats out of FA Cup |url=http://www.shieldsgazette.com/sport/sunderland-afc/latest-safc-news/arsenal-3-sunderland-1-gunners-fight-back-to-knock-cats-out-of-fa-cup-1-7665597 |newspaper=Shields Gazette |accessdate=9 January 2016}}</ref> He made his Premier League debut against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] at [[White Hart Lane]] on 16 January 2016 losing 4–1, meaning he had played in the top five leagues of English football by the age of 21.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/60834 |title=Pickford promise fulfilled for club and country |publisher=Premier League |date=16 July 2016 |accessdate=12 November 2017}}</ref> On 26 January, Pickford signed a new contract committing his future to Sunderland until 2020.<ref name="skysports.com"/>
Pickford began the [[2016–17 Sunderland A.F.C. season|2016–17]] season as understudy to Vito Mannone. However, after Mannone suffered a serious arm injury in training, Pickford started Sunderland's third league match of the season, away to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]. He produced several saves during the match, but in the 85th minute he made an error which allowed [[Jay Rodriguez]] to equalise for the hosts in a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3761414/Southampton-1-1-Sunderland-Super-sub-Jay-Rodriguez-strikes-level-Jermain-Defore-penalty-Saints-grandstand-finish-t-force-victory.html |title=Southampton 1–1 Sunderland: David Moyes refuses to deny interest in Joe Hart after Jordan Pickford error costs Black Cats first win in August since 2010 |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |accessdate=11 October 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=October 2017}}</ref><ref name="Echo_October2016"/> On 13 April 2017, Pickford was named as one of six players shortlisted for the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] award.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.thepfa.com/news/2017/4/13/pfa-mens-young-player-of-the-year |title=Men's PFA Young Player of the Year 2017 |date=13 April 2017 |publisher=Professional Footballers' Association}}</ref>
===Everton=== ====2017–18 season==== On 15 June 2017, Pickford signed for Premier League club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on a five-year contract. The initial fee of £25 million, with the possibility of rising to £30 million in add-ons, made him [[Goalkeeper (association football)#Highest fees|the third most expensive goalkeeper in history]], the most expensive British goalkeeper of all time and will make him Everton's second most expensive signing, pending add-on payments,<ref>{{cite news |title=Jordan Pickford: Everton confirm £25m, rising to £30m, deal with Sunderland |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40258852 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 June 2017 |accessdate=5 September 2017}}</ref> as [[Gylfi Sigurðsson]] is currently the club's most expensive signing with £40 million plus add-on payments.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40848343 |title=Gylfi Sigurdsson: Everton sign £45m deal for Swansea midfielder |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2017 |accessdate=9 September 2017}}</ref> Pickford made his league debut for Everton on 12 August 2017, when his club beat [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] 1–0 at Goodison Park.<ref name=sb1718/> At the conclusion of his first season, he was named Everton's Player of the Season, along with numerous other club accolades.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11671/11355385/jordan-pickford-honoured-after-dominating-everton-awards-night |title=Jordan Pickford 'honoured' after dominating Everton awards night |publisher=Sky Sports |date=1 May 2017 |accessdate=4 July 2018}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== On 2 December in the [[Merseyside Derby]] against local rivals [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], Pickford made a last-minute mistake after he mishandled a volley from [[Virgil van Dijk]], allowing [[Divock Origi]] to score the winning goal for Liverpool from a close-range header in the 96th minute.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46333097 |title=Liverpool 1–0 Everton: Jordan Pickford error gifts Divock Origi late winner |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 December 2018 |accessdate=12 December 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/liverpool-everton-jordan-pickford-mistake-goal-error-divock-origi-a8664181.html |title= Liverpool vs Everton: Jordan Pickford explains what he was trying to do in 'freak' mistake |publisher=The Independent |date=2 December 2018 |accessdate=12 December 2018}}</ref>
==International career== ===Youth=== [[File:2017083200955 2017-03-24 Fussball U21 Deutschland vs England - Sven - 1D X - 0153 - DV3P6479 - Jordan Pickford.jpg|thumb|upright|Pickford playing for [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] in 2017]]
Pickford has represented the England international team at every level from under-16s to under-21s.<ref name="Echo_October2016">{{cite news |title=10 things you may not know about England new boy Jordan Pickford |url=http://www.sunderlandecho.com/sport/football/sunderland-afc/10-things-you-may-not-know-about-england-new-boy-jordan-pickford-1-8173261 |newspaper=Sunderland Echo |accessdate=13 June 2017 |language=en}}</ref> In October 2009, he made his [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] debut against [[Wales national under-16 football team|Wales U16]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Bruce chasing Zenden |url=http://www.thenorthernecho.co.uk/sport/4686565.Bruce_chasing_Zenden |newspaper=The Northern Echo |location=Darlington |date=16 October 2009 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref> In 2011, Pickford represented England at the [[2011 FIFA U-17 World Cup]]. In a game versus Canada, Pickford allowed an 86th-minute goal, from a downfield kick by Canadian goalkeeper [[Quillan Roberts]] which tied the game in a 2–2 draw,<ref>{{Cite news |title=Canadian goalkeeper makes history with goal at u17 World Cup |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/sports/soccer/canadian-goalkeeper-makes-history-with-goal-at-u-17-world-cup/article584267/ |publisher=The Globe and Mail |accessdate=5 April 2014}}</ref> which remains as the only goal scored by a goalkeeper in a FIFA finals to date from open play.<ref>{{cite web |title=Uruguay advance as records fell |url=https://www.fifa.com/u17worldcup/news/newsid=1458456/index.html |publisher=FIFA |accessdate=14 July 2018}}</ref>
On 25 August 2015, he was called up to the [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21]] squad for the first time.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sunderlandecho.com/sport/sunderland-afc/latest-safc-news/safc-match-analysis/sunderland-s-duncan-watmore-and-jordan-pickford-selected-for-england-u21s-1-7427777 |title=Sunderland's Duncan Watmore and Jordan Pickford selected for England U21s |newspaper=Sunderland Echo |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> Pickford made his debut for the under-21s in a [[Exhibition game#Association football|friendly]] against the [[United States men's national under-23 soccer team|United States under-23s]] at Deepdale on 3 September 2015.<ref name="Echo_October2016"/>
On 14 October, Pickford assisted [[Nathan Redmond]]'s goal in the England U21s' 3–0 victory over [[Kazakhstan national under-21 football team|Kazakhstan]] at the [[Ricoh Arena]] with a long range pass from his own penalty area.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sunderlandecho.com/sport/sunderland-afc/latest-safc-news/safc-match-analysis/watch-sunderland-s-ace-goalkeeper-jordan-pickford-hailed-after-england-assist-1-7513763 |title=Watch: Sunderland's ace goalkeeper Jordan Pickford hailed after England assist |newspaper=Sunderland Echo |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> His team won the [[2016 Toulon Tournament]], their first in 22 years.<ref name=toulon>{{cite news |title=England Under-21s win Toulon Tournament for first time in 22 years |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36410296 |accessdate=11 October 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 May 2016}}</ref>
On 9 October 2016, Pickford received his first call-up to the [[England national football team|senior squad]], replacing an injured [[Tom Heaton]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification|2018 FIFA World Cup qualifier]] against [[Slovenia national football team|Slovenia]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.safc.com/news/team-news/2016/october/pickford-gets-england-call |title=Pickford for England |publisher=Sunderland A.F.C. |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref>
Pickford led the England under-21 to the semi-final of the [[2017 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] in June 2017 with a string of strong performances.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/8/main/2017/06/30/36749952/saul-pickford-star-in-euro-under-21-team-of-the-tournament |title=Saul & Pickford star in Euro Under-21 Team of the Tournament |publisher=Goal.com |date=30 June 2017}}</ref>
===Senior team=== [[File:Jordan Pickford 2018-07-03 1.jpg|thumb|upright|Pickford playing for [[England national football team|England]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]]]
On 24 August 2017, Pickford was called up to the England squad by manager [[Gareth Southgate]] for two 2018 FIFA World Cup qualifiers against [[Malta national football team|Malta]] and [[Slovakia national football team|Slovakia]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/aug/24/england-squad-maguire-chalobah-slovakia-malta |title=Harry Maguire and Nathaniel Chalobah called up to England squad for first time |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=24 August 2017 |accessdate=12 November 2017}}</ref> However, he later withdrew from the squad due to injury.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/aug/29/jordan-pickford-out-england-squad-world-cup-qualifiers |title=Jordan Pickford ruled out of England's squad for World Cup qualifiers |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=29 August 2017 |accessdate=5 September 2017}}</ref> Pickford made his debut in a friendly on 10 November 2017, starting as England drew 0–0 with [[Germany national football team|Germany]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=England 0–0 Germany |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41854505 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 November 2017 |accessdate=11 November 2017}}</ref>
Pickford was named in the 23-man [[England national football team|England national team]] squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44138600 |title=England World Cup squad: Trent Alexander-Arnold in 23-man squad |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2018 |accessdate=17 May 2018}}</ref> He started the opening match against [[Tunisia national football team|Tunisia]], which England won 2–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44434276 |title=Tunisia 1–2 England |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 June 2018 |accessdate=19 June 2018}}</ref> In their round of 16 match on 3 July, Pickford helped England beat [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]] 4–3 on [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalties]] after a 1–1 draw, saving from [[Carlos Bacca]], to claim his nation's first World Cup penalty shoot-out victory and a place in the quarter-final.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44610244 |title=Colombia 1–1 England |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 July 2018 |accessdate=3 July 2018}}</ref>
On 7 July 2018, Pickford kept his first clean sheet of the World Cup and was named man of the match, as England knocked out [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]] with a 2–0 win in the quarter-finals. The result earned England a place in the semi-finals of the World Cup for the first time since [[1990 FIFA World Cup|1990]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44665445 |title=World Cup 2018: England beat Sweden 2–0 to reach semi-finals |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 July 2018 |accessdate=7 July 2018}}</ref>
